name: Sarah
text: I DO NOT recommend this place of business to anyone.  I took my uniform pants to be altered and they were pinned to the correct length while I was in the cleaners.  When I went to pick the pants up, they were approximately one inch shorter than the length they were originally pinned. I returned the pants to the cleaners and advised they were too short and they needed to be fixed to the correct length.  At that time, I was told there would be no charge to correct their mistake.  I went to pick the uniforms up after they were fixed and was told that the uniforms were not there and they must have been given to another customer in error.  They attempted to call the customers that could possibly have them in their possession and was unable to locate the pants on that day.  When they called to tell me they couldn't locate the pants, I asked to speak to the owner.  I was told that she was out of town.  I asked for her phone number and was told that the number could not be given out and that she would have her call me.  The owner never called.  The following day, I received a call that the pants had been located and I could come and pick them up.  When I picked the pants up, I was charged AGAIN for their error for having to alter them again when they made the mistake the first time.  I would not recommend this establishment to anyone, nor would I take a bag of garbage to them to clean.  Additionally, the owner has yet to call or attempt to rectify the situation in any manner whatsoever!

name: Nathan Gibbs
text: Great cleaners and always have the nucest staff working there! Thank you!

text: Took 2 small pet dresses in for one button each. One small pet dress to do small area sewing. They charged me $18.00 and didn't do anything. The buttons fell off when I examined them and the sewing was not done. This is sloppy work and I will not be back!

text: My friend loves the service they provide, I pick her cleaning up every week,,,,very friendly and courteous service,,,,,5 stars for real.

text: They do a good job, but they lost a group of my shirts.  I left multiple messages with the manager before I was able to speak with her.   She was supposed to research and get back with me but never did.  So I never got my shirts nor a refund on what I had paid.   Have since went to another business.

name: Crystal A
text: I brought in a comforter set for dry cleaning, and even though the price was reasonable, when I picked up the set and brought it home, I was seriously disappointed.  The smell of dry cleaning chemicals was overpowering.  I put it outside to air out all day and the stench was still there. My eyes and throat burned from the smell, and airing it did nothing to make it better.  I’m going to have to take it to another cleaners to see if they can get the smell out.  I have never had this problem at my old cleaners, and if they hadn’t gone out of business, I would have used them.

I never see anyone working in the back and they never have any lights on in the cleaners.  All bad signs to me.  They don't seem to make a good impression.

name: Keyome DT
text: I had been using the cleaner for about two years. So I had no reason to be worried when I used them to clean my wedding dress. My dress was cocktail length and not very fancy. My husband dropped it off. When I picked it up they young lady said that will be 169.00!!!! More than I PAID for the dress!!! I was shocked. I was kind to the young lady behind the counter but let her know I would be checking with my husband to make sure the price had not been pre approved by him. After checking with him I knew it had not been pre approved. I called to complain. The manager called me the following week and was very very rude. She stated that she was certain I had been made aware of the price. Ummm, no,, why would we approve the price more than the worth of the dress. Then said that it was "suspicious" that I didn't pitch a fit and did pay at the counter. I expressed that I thought I had handled it very nicely. She didn't care and continued to accuse. The owner has still yet to call us to resolve this situation. DO NOT USE THEM! Unless you are rich and do not care about wasting your money.

name: Vu Le
text:
I sent a custom tailored suit in, as well as a standard white shirt, for dry cleaning and it was picked up by my girlfriend. The shirt still had obvious stains on the collar, so she left it to be cleaned again. The suit however, has somehow been ruined. It looks as though it has been put in a washer machine; the cuffs are somehow coming inside out as I wear it, and the lapel is wrinkled. There was also a stain on the back collar of the suit that I was able to take off by scratching at it.

I haven’t had any issues with dry cleaning before  and I tried this business for the first time, right before a wedding. I wish I had just waited for my usual shop to open up instead. Extremely dissatisfied.

resp.text:
Mr. Le,
I’m sorry for the problem and would very much like to bring resolution to the matter. I’m unable to locate your info in our computer system. Could you please call my office at 706-323-7774 when get a chance or send me your contact info?
Thank you.
Rhonda Eysel

name: Sa'Vaughie French
text:
I dropped off a garment to have a strap fixed on Monday as was told that it would be ready by Wednesday. It is now Friday and it's not ready. I needed this for a trip I'm taking this weekend.

Edit. Thank you to the owner for reaching out to me , personally, on Friday. It's refreshing to know that my business is important to your company. The situation was rectified and I was able to have my clothing in time for my trip.

resp.text: Ms. French, I am so sorry your garment wasn't ready when promised. I appreciate you taking my call on Friday, June 5th and am glad we were able to have it ready for you to take on your trip. We appreciate you. Kindly, Rhonda Eysel

text: I have been using Worth Cleaners for several years and continue to be impressed with their quality, service and friendly staff. name: Kimberly Lewis
text:
I went to this location on November 7th to see of they would clean an area rug. The lady that checked me in looked at the rug, consulted with another worker that was there at the time, gave me a ticket, and told me that the rug would be ready around the same time the following week. I called on November 14th to check the status of the rug. I was told "Yes, the rug is ready, but we couldn't clean it." I asked her why did anyone not call me to let me know that it could not be cleaned? Basically all I got was an "I don't know" and some other pathetic excuse. I immediately proceeded to pick up my uncleaned rug that has just been sitting on a table for an entire week.
For the entire life of me, I do not understand why something as simple as a phone call did not happen. As soon as they saw that they could not accommodate, all they had to do was call and say, "We apologize for the inconvenience, but we cannot clean your rug." I would have happily returned to pick up my rug and found another company to clean it. I am pretty sure that someone knew that Friday morning after I dropped off, that they would not be able to clean my rug. But NO, the rug just sat there until I called to check on it.  A simple phone call. Communication, communication, communication. Inconsideration and/or laziness. But regardless, there was absolutely no reason why I was not contacted. This was my first and most definitely my last visit.

name: Tony Drake
text: The folks at Worth Cleaners on Vaughn Road are like family.  They hustle to get me in and out as quickly as possible since I come in on my way to work. They are always pleasant and always happy to see me.  The clothes are always clean and starched just like I like them.  I couldn't ask for better service.

name: Kaleigh Flatt
text: By far the best dry cleaners in Montgomery! I have had items ruined at some of the other dry cleaners in town and charged an arm and a leg by the others. I like that Worth Cleaners posts their prices on their website so I know how much everything's going to cost before I go. Plus their staff is super friendly. I would definitely recommend Worth Cleaners.

name: Cecilia Ike
text: If you do not care about your clothes and want them ruined, you have come to the right place. I recently purchased 2 pretty gowns for my daughters, they wore it to one family occasion before we sent it to worth cleaners. They tore one and used their dryer to shrink the organza fabric overlay of the other one. They returned the clothes without mentioning anything about the damage(very fraudulent people) and when I asked them about it, they stated that they only followed the instructions on the care label, that I needed to go back to the store where I bought it (belk, 21 days ago) and complain to the manufacturer about the wrong care label. Seriously......for even the torn outfit? I don't understand why these scammers are still in business. I left the 2 gowns with them and they are yet to contact me 3 weeks later. There are so many credible laundry services out there, do not make my mistake!!

resp.text: Dizzy, we are very sorry to hear about your experience. We strive to give every customer that walks through the door the best possible cleaning service and we are sorry that you feel that wasn't the case. Please reach out if you would like to discuss this matter any further. Thank you, Worth Cleaners.

name: Diana Courrech
text:
The name of this laundromat is the complete opposite of what it actually is.  There’s trash on the floor, the folding tables have trash and hair, the other tables with seating have some kind of gunk on them, and the change machine shorted me a quarter.  Also, there was no hand soap or toilet tissue in the restroom.  I think the person who works here noticed I was taking pictures because he started picking up trash from the floor. I have several photos to add in this post but for some reason I’m unable to upload load them all unfortunately.

The worst part of all the washers were filthy.   This is the most filthy and disgusting laundromat I have ever been to.  I will NOT be back!

name: Earl Lalik
text:
In town on business for a few weeks

Not so nice, and DEFINITELY NOT clean!

1/2 of the machines are out of order, and 1/2 of the others, steal your money because they are broken as well.

Definitely the Slums of laundry mat

Lost over $5.00 in quarters trying to find a machine that worked

At some point, I had lost enough money, it became personal, and I kept trying just do I could “hit the jackpot” and get my laundry done

AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE

name: Alisa Vernon
text: This place is horrible... The washers & dryers are always out of order.. the washers sometimes dont spin the water out of your clothes so u have to wash them ALL OVER AGAIN.. YOU WILL DEFINITELY SPEND WAY TOO MUCH IF U ARENT AWARE OF THESE THINGS.. JUST PLAIN HORRIBLE..

name: Janet Stuart
text: This place has gone downhill.  Someone has removed all the rolling baskets to move clothes from the washers to the dryers.  This is ridiculous.

text: I called the owner to tell them that the machines weren't working right, not spinning out patrons clothes, there was water all over the floor and how the dryers took my money. No one answered so I told them how it wasn't nice and clean and how disgusting the place is. Oh and did I mention that I found a meth pipe in the floor and basically it's a hangout for the homeless.

text: Just don't go here. 3/4 of machines not working. The dryer failed, one smelled like moldy fish.

text: If I could give 0 stars I would... I lost $8 bucks in these machines today.  About 25% of the machines work collectively, and that’s being generous.  I left a message at the number they advertise and no one has called me back.  I’m addition a man comes in smelling like a wine shack first saying he owned the place and then he told us (I was not the only one to inform him we lost money) he was just the clean up man.  He didn’t clean a thing but he did high tail it out of there.. my last time at this place, I doubt I get a call about my lost coins too

text: They literally rob you if you swipe your card! I had to file a dispute with my bank in order to get my $12.50 back, yet the owner was in the store kept lying that he was a patron then tried to say it wasn’t on him that the machine glitches and kept charging my card. Refused to give my money back! Hot water wash is actually cold water, no toilet paper in the bathrooms. I wouldn’t even rate them 1 star but that’s the lowest offered!!!! 😡😡😡😡

text: I will admit that the large washers to wash comforter sets are very good but to dry my clothes—that’s a whole different story! It took me several attempts to dry my clothes and I feel like it’s a rip off. They need to fix the dryers and have better maintenance of the washers, dryers and facility as a whole.

name: Phillip Pryor
text: I come here because I have to. The machines take debit cards. The machine clearly states 3.75 for a wash. My card was charged 12.50... The management is so worried about the homeless hanging around that it’s driving business down. So the owners are forced to steal from actual paying patrons.

name: Scott Anderson
text: Whoa. This place is a wreck. About half the washers don’t work, and the rest are pretty busted up. They leak soap from the trays, and water from somewhere. Dirty nasty place. Apparently no or very limited air conditioning. $2.75 a load for washing, but sometimes the machine doesn’t register the coins, so you will end up paying more. Go elsewhere.

name: Stephanie Staton
text: If I could give this place zero stars I would its run by drunks and crack heads that called the law on a couple college kids just because they didn't like them sitting with their car running with the head lights on. Just saying most newer cars have automatic headlights that you can't turn off unless you shut off your car, and it's hot and muggy outside y'all

name: Lindsey Hardy
text: WORST LAUNDROMAT EVER! Don’t waste your money here.

name: Elzabeth Bettis
text: I used this laundromat twice before. I won't be going back. There is NO attendent on duty. I was there washing clothes alone. There were men coming in and out of the laundromat just hanging around and not washing anything. It made me upset. Just to have men walking back and forth to the gas station and just hanging around the laundromat smoking. As I was about to leave a man came in and put his wet dirty work clothes in a dryer. It was raining and he came in and literally took his dirty wet pants off in front of me and put them in a clean dryer.

name: Jeremysara Maloy
text: I needed wash, dry, fold service for laundry.  We are a military family and the movers took our washer and dryer.  I needed clean laundry before we left town and didn’t have time to sit at a laundromat.  I didn’t realize this service usually takes about three days.  I went in on a Thursday and was told that getting it back by a Monday would be a stretch.  (We were driving out of state Tuesday morning).  Worth cleaners went out of their way to get my laundry done-  washed , dried, and folded the next day!!! I was so thankful!  They made my life a lot easier when there was so much stress going on.  Thank you  Worth Cleaners for going out of your way for this military family!!

name: Melissa Yaros
text: Just moved here and decided on this cleaners based on the reviews. Horrible mistake.  Why would I pay a cleaners to launder and press shirts if they looked better before they went there?  Such a waste of time and money. If I could post pictures here I would.

name: Darrell Bradshaw
text: I had the most difficult stains and I shadowed it to the lady at the front.  She was confident they would get them clean, and they did.   BEST cleaners in Montgomery

name: Lynn Leger
text: Left a dress with a Dothan AL branch that is owned by Worth Cleaners. The first time it wasn’t back when promised and came back with spots that it didn’t come there with. The second time it came back the beading in the collar was completely destroyed! Beads hanging off and sequin missing and discolored! The owner Steve Worth called and said it was the manufacturers fault and he has no intention of doing anything! STAY AWAy!!!

name: Teresa Baxley
text: Amazing company!!! Owner that goes out of his way to serve his clients.  5 stars are not enough!!!

name: Christina Wild
text: I have had the worst experience with this dry cleaning company! I received a $25 gift certificate from this company for being new to the neighborhood. It specificly states "$25 gift certificate on dry cleaning. Use these two locations. Use before 90 days of receiving this." So I took my $300 down comforter in to get dry cleaned. I came I with the gift certificate and was wanting to pay the difference. The lady looked at it and said the weren't able to take it because it's a comforter. I told her on it doesn't state what to dry clean and what not to dry clean. She said she was going to save it with the receipt and wait for the manager to get back so he would be able to take it off the ticket. I have been waiting for someone to call me for the past two weeks!!!! The owner mr.worth hasn't called me either. Not only will the take your gift certificate they will take your $300 comforter and won't return your phone calls! They present these gift certificates as false advertisement and I'm about to get in touch with the better business burial about the situation they are putting me in. I do not recommend using them!!!! Stay far far away!

text: Very reasonable and a good job !

text: This cleaners is the worst place for alterations! Do not use them! They took over a month to put in a zipper on a skirt. They originally said it would be $24 and then charged $25. Yeah, I know it's just a dollar, but they should be giving me a discount for my troubles, definitely not charging more. The guy said they send alterations out to a company that does high volume and isn't interested in doing one skirt-- would have been nice to know that over a month ago, buddy.
